pkgmetadata.longdescription: kmscon is a DRM-based system console. It can run alongside (or without) the built-in Linux console or graphical environments such as X11, and has many modern features, including internationalization, anti-aliased and runtime-scalable text, multi-seat operation, and OpenGL ES rendering.

use.flag: Enable the software-only DRM output backend.
Enable the software-only fbdev output backend. Only needed if you have a legacy driver that doesn't support KMS.
Enable hardware-accelerated rendering and output using OpenGL ES 2.0.
Use x11-libs/pixman as an alternative to the built-in software renderer.
Use a bundled, compiled-in copy of GNU Unifont for Unicode-capable output.
